intro: Vincetoxicum hastulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Vincetoxicum hastulatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
